column3: Lumbee Indians in the Jim Crow south : race, identity, and the making of a nation
column9: On November 21st, 2009, historian Malinda Lowery presented a talk in conjunction with the museum's 14th annual American Indian Heritage Celebration. An associate professor of history at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Lowery is the author of several books and worked as a producer and director on several award-winning documentary films. In her talk, she discusses the history and struggles, including the longtime pursuit of federal recognition of the Lumbee Tribe.
